item.title: Why Clear Expectations Are the Key to Employee Productivity and Morale
item.description: Few things kill morale faster than not knowing what’s expected of you at work.

item.title: Patience in Leadership Means Letting Things Unfold Naturally
item.description: True leadership requires learning to focus on the things that truly matter.

item.title: How to Shield Yourself in Shareholder Lawsuits by Using the Business Judgment Rule
item.description: Acting in good faith can protect your company in a shareholder lawsuit.

item.title: Ethics: Management Is Reassigning Jobs Under a “One Company” Slogan. My Team Isn’t Happy
item.description: Management wants extra work but offers no extra reward.

item.title: Zippers Might Be Getting a Makeover
item.description: Is a redesign for zippers overdue by 100 years? Or are we trying to fix something that’s not broken?
